item.title: Baldur's Gate 3: Best Weapons For Each Patch 8 Subclass
item.description:
Baldur's Gate 3 released Patch 8 as a final send-off for the game, bringing a last touch-up and a few new features, including Photo Mode and 12 new Subclasses for players to enjoy. Players looking to jump into one of these new class options will likely already be aware that the better synergized your Class, Feat, equipment, and Spell selections are, the more efficient your build will be as you progress through the game.

With every new Class gaining a new Subclass following the Patch 8 update, there are plenty of new build options for players to explore. As expected, when opting to try and create one of these builds, there are endless options when it comes to equipment such as armor, accessories, and weapon choice. If you're looking for some indicators on the best weapon types for each Patch 8 Subclass in Baldur's Gate 3 and some of the strongest options for that weapon type, all relevant information has been outlined in the guide below.

Best Weapons For Each Patch 8 Subclass in Baldur's Gate 3

In Baldur's Gate 3 , twelve new Subclasses were added in Patch 8 for players to enjoy. The spread consists of one new Subclass for each core Class in the game. The complete list of them can be seen below:

  • Arcane Archer Fighter
  • Bladesinging Wizard
  • Circle of the Stars Druid
  • College of Glamour Bard
  • Death Domain Cleric
  • Path of Giants Barbarian
  • Hexblade Warlock
  • Oath of the Crown Paladin
  • Shadow Magic Sorcerer
  • Swarmkeeper Ranger
  • Swashbuckler Rogue
  • Way of the Drunken Master Monk

Best Weapons For Arcane Archer Fighter

  • Best Weapon Types : Primarily bows, but you can sometimes pair melee weapons, particularly if you're stacking effects, such as with the Club of Hill Giant Strength.

The Joltshooter

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

The Joltshooter

Bow

310 Gold

Rare

Electric Blood - When the wielder deals damage using this weapon, they gain 2 Lightning Charges.

  • How to obtain : From Counsellor Florrick at Waukeen's Rest as a reward for completing the Rescue the Grand Duke quest.

Titanstring Bow

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Titanstring Bow

Bow

310 Gold

Rare

Titan Weapon - This weapon deals additional damage equal to your Strength Modifier.

How to obtain : From Brem at the Zhentarium Basement after completing Find the Missing Shipment, or from Lann Tarv at Moonrise Towers.

Club of Hill Giant Strength

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Club of Hill Giant Strength

Club

65 Gold

Uncommon

Splinters of a Giant's Might - Increases Strength to 19.

How to obtain : Obtained by breaking the Stool of Hill Giant Strength at Arcane Tower.

Harold

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Harold

Bow

480 Gold

Rare

Haroldish Doom - When dealing damage to a target with a ranged weapon, the target must succeed on a Charisma Save or be Baned for 2 turns.

How to obtain : From Zhentarim Hideout, as a reward for bringing the chest to Zarys.

The Dead Shot

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

The Dead Shot

Bow

770 Gold

Very Rare

Improved Critical - The number you need to roll a Critical Hit while attacking is reduced by 1. This effect can stack.

Keen Attack - The wielder doubles their Proficiency Bonus when rolling ranged attacks with this weapon, unless they have Disadvantage.

How to obtain : Purchase from Fytz the Firecracker at Stormshore Armoury.

Best Weapons For Bladesinging Wizard

Best Weapon Types : Melee weapons, such as swords, rapiers, scimitars, sickles, and daggers, as these are the weapons with which the Bladesinger has Proficiency.

Phalar Aluve

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Phalar Aluve

Longsword

250 Gold

Rare

Performance +1

Phalar Aluve: Melody - The sword hums in anticipation, ready to Sing or Shriek once per Short Rest.

  • How to obtain : Embedded inside a rock in the Underdark at approximately X: 116 Y: -192

Hunter's Dagger

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Hunter's Dagger

Dagger

65 Gold

Uncommon

Rupturing - On a hit, the target becomes Ruptured for 3 turns.

  • How to obtain : Purchase from Roah Moonglow at Shattered Sanctum.

Speedy Reply

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Speedy Reply

Scimitar

65 Gold

Uncommon

Nimble Attack - When the wielder hits an enemy with this weapon, they gain Momentum for 2 turns.

  • How to obtain : On the body of a dead caravan agent on RIsen Road, at approximately X: 25 Y: 603.

Knife of the Undermountain King

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Knife of the Undermountain King

Shortsword

480 Gold

Very Rare

Organ Rearranger - Reduce the number you need to roll a Critical Hit while attacking by 1. This effect can stack. When you roll 2 damage or less, reroll the dice, taking the highest result.

Shadow Blade - You have Advantage on Attack Rolls against Lightly or Heavily Obscured targets when using this blade.

  • How to obtain : Sold by A'jak'nir Jeera at the Githyanki Creche.

Adamantine Shortsword

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Adamantine Longsword

Longsword

100 Gold

Rare

Diamondsbane - If an Adamantine weapon hits an object, the hit is always critical.

Lethal Weapons - This weapon ignores Resistance to Slashing damage.

  • How to obtain : Forged at the Adamantine Forge.

Best Weapons For Circle of the Stars Druid

Best Weapon Types : Bows, Quarterstaffs, and, on occasion, some other key weapon choices that can grant additional utility or Spells for your build.

Gontr Mael

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Gontr Mael

Bow

1000 Gold

Legendary

Celestial Haste - Cast at lv. 3 once per Long Rest.

Promised Victory - On a hit, possibly inflict Guiding Bolt on your target.

Gontr Mael: Glowing - This object shines with a glowing light at a radius of 20ft. Toggle this to douse and rekindle the light.

  • How to obtain : Carried by the Steel Watcher Titan in the Control Center.

The Joltshooter

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

The Joltshooter

Bow

310 Gold

Rare

Electric Blood - When the wielder deals damage using this weapon, they gain 2 Lightning Charges.

  • How to obtain : From Counsellor Florrick at Waukeen's Rest as a reward for completing the Rescue the Grand Duke quest.

Markoheshkir

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Markoheshkir

Quarterstaff

640 Gold

Legendary

Kereska's Favour - Cast as a level 4 spell once per Short Rest.

Arcane Enchantment - You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack rolls.

Arcane Battery - Alleviate the arcane burden of spellcasting with the power of this staff. The next spell you cast doesn't cost a spell slot.

  • How to obtain : Found in a Globe of Invulnerability at Ramazith's Tower

Fabricated Arbalest

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Fabricated Arbalest

Bow

960 Gold

Very Rare

Dazzling Ray - Unleash a beam of brilliant light that Blinds all creatures in its path - Once per Short Rest

Illuminating Shot - Fire a shimmering bolt that inflicts 1 turn of Radiating Orb upon the target.

  • How to obtain : Loot from Enver Gortash at Wyrm's Rock Fortress.

Mourning Frost

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Mourning Frost

Quarterstaff

770 Gold

Very Rare

Ray of Frost - Cast at will.

Heart of Ice - When dealing Cold damage, the wielder deals an additional 1 damage.

Insidious Cold - Dealing Cold damage with a spell possibly inflicts Chilled upon the target.

  • How to obtain : Combine Icy Crystal, Icy Helve, and Icy Metal—all located in the Underdark.

Best Weapons For College of Glamour Bard

Best Weapon Types : Primarily DEX-based weapons, such as bows, rapiers, shortswords, and daggers.

Worgfang

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Worgfang

Dagger

260 Gold

Uncommon

Goblin's Undoing - Goblins have Disadvantage on Attack Rolls against the user.

  • How to obtain : On a pile of bones in one of the cells in the Warg Pens at the Goblin Camp's Shattered Sanctum.

Infernal Rapier

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Infernal Rapier

Rapier

960

Very Rare

Planar Ally: Cambion - Cast at lv. 6 once per Long Rest

High Spellcasting - You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC.

Melee Caster - Instead of its Dexterity Modifier, the affected entity adds its Spellcasting Ability Modifier to Attack rolls.

  • How to obtain : Free Mizora and pass the Persuasion Check.

Hellrider Longbow

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Hellrider Longbow

Bow

770

Uncommon

Heightened Awareness - Gain a +3 bonus to Initiative rolls and Advantage on Perception checks.

Fiendish Fire - Once per turn, a creature hit by this weapon will possibly be afflicted with Faerie Fire.

  • How to obtain : Purchase from Ferg Drogher near the Requisitioned Barn.

Phalar Aluve

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Phalar Aluve

Longsword

250 Gold

Rare

Performance +1

Phalar Aluve: Melody - The sword hums in anticipation, ready to Sing or Shriek once per Short Rest.

  • How to obtain : Embedded inside a rock in the Underdark at approximately X: 116 Y: -192

Harmonic Dueller

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Harmonic Dueller

Rapier

380 Gold

Rare

Mellow Harmony - You make a DC 15 Performance check, with success granting all your melee weapon attacks additional damage equal to your Charisma Modifier.

  • How to obtain : Purchase from Entharl Danthelon in Wyrm's Crossing.

Best Weapons For Death Domain Cleric

Best Weapon Types : Items that offer Necromancy magic buffs or utility that Death Domain Cleric can benefit from.

tem

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Hollow's Staff

Quarterstaff

310 Gold

Rare

Arms of Hadar - Lv. 3 Once Per Long Rest

Heightened Necromancy - Creatures have Disadvantage on Saving Throws against your Necromancy spells.

  • How to obtain : Carried by Lucretious at Circus of the Last Days.

Staff of Cherished Necromancy

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Staff of Cherished Necromancy

Quarterstaff

480 Gold

Very Rare

Heightened Necromancy - Creatures have Disadvantage on Saving Throws against your Necromancy spells.

Life Essence Harvest - When the wielder kills a hostile creature with a spell, they greedily absorb its energy and gain Life Essence until the next Long Rest.

  • How to obtain : Can be looted from Mystic Carrion at Philgrave's Mansion.

Hunting Shortbow

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Hunting Shortbow

Bow

65 Gold

Uncommon

Hunter's Mark - Cast at lv. 1 once per Long Rest.

Feller of Monsters - You have an Advantage against Monstrosity-type enemies.

  • How to obtain : Purchase from Dammon at Emerald Grove.

Cacophony

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Cacophony

Quarterstaff

310 Gold

Rare

Thunderous Smite - Cast at lv. 1 once per Short Rest.

  • How to obtain : Sold by Lady Esther on the Mountain Pass.

Sword of Screams

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Sword of Screams

Rapier

130 Gold

Uncommon

+1d4 Psychic on hit

  • How to obtain : Loot from True Soul Nere at Grymforge.

Best Weapons For Path of Giants Barbarian

Best Weapon Types : Thrown weapons—particularly those that return to the user's hand—and STR-based melee weapons such as swords, hammers, clubs, and other two-handed great weapons.

The Returning Pike

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Returning Pike

Pike

65 Gold

Uncommon

Homing Weapon - This weapon will return to its owner when thrown.

  • How to obtain : Sold by Grat the Trader at the Goblin Camp.

Lightning Jabber

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Lightning Jabber

Spears

65 Gold

Uncommon

Shocking Sting - On a hit, possibly Shock your target.

Throwing: Lightning Damage - When launched at a target, deal an additional 1d4 Lightning damage.

  • How to obtain : Carried by the cursed Kuo-Toa Chief in the ambush northeast of the Grand Mausoleum entrance.

Nyrulna

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Nyrulna

Trident

840 Gold

Legendary

Zephyr Connection - This weapon will return to your hand when thrown. You cannot be forced to drop the trident. When thrown, the weapon creates an explosion that deals 3d4 Thunder damage in a 20 ft blast centered on the target.

Veil of the Wind - You gain a 10 ft movement speed and jump distance bonus. Equipping this weapon gives you Immunity to falling damage.

Nyrulna: Glowing - This object shines with a glowing light in a radius of 20 ft.

  • How to obtain : In a locked painted chest, near the portal to exit the Jungle area that you get to through Akabi the Genie's wheel.

Selune's Spear of Night

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Selune's Spear of Night

Spear

640

Legendary

Darkvision

Moonbeam - Cast at lv. 3 once per Long Rest.

Moonmote - Cast as Cantrip once per Long Rest.

Selune's Blessing - You gain Advantage on Wisdom Saving throws and Perception Checks.

  • How to obtain : Reward from Aylin for sparing the Nightsong.

Shar's Spear of Evening

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Shar's Spear of Evening

Spear

640

Legendary

Shar's Darkness - Cast at lv. 2 once per Long Rest.

Blind Immunity - The wearer cannot be Blinded.

Shar's Blessing - You gain Advantage on Saving throws while Lightly or Heavily Obscured. This weapon deals an additional 1d6 damage to creatures that are Lightly or Heavily Obscured.

  • How to obtain : Rewarded to Shadowheart for killing the Nightsong.

Best Weapons For Hexblade Warlock

Best Weapon Types : Strong melee weapons (usually DEX-based) that the Hexblade can bind as a Pact/Hex Weapon and benefit from.

Duelist's Prerogative

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Duelist's Prerogative

Rapier

1300 Gold

Legendary

Challenge to Duel - Challenge an enemy to attack only you, inflicting Bleeding on the target.

Elegant Duelist - While your off-hand is empty, you score a Critical Hit when rolling a 19. Moreover, you gain an additional Reaction per turn.

Withering Cut - On a hit with a melee weapon, use a Reaction to deal additional Necrotic damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • How to obtain : Reward from Lora Bergauz for completing the quest Save Vanra.

Everburn Blade

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Everburn Blade

Greatsword

130 Gold

Uncommon

+1d4 Fire damage on hit.

  • How to obtain : Carried by Commander Zhalk at the helm of the Nautiloid at the beginning of Act 1.

Phalar Aluve

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Phalar Aluve

Longsword

250 Gold

Rare

Performance +1

Phalar Aluve: Melody - The sword hums in anticipation, ready to Sing or Shriek once per Short Rest.

  • How to obtain : Embedded inside a rock in the Underdark at approximately X: 116 Y: -192

The Banfeul

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

The Baneful

Shortsword

190 Gold

Rare

Favored Weapon - This weapon has a +1 bonus to damage and Attack rolls.

Baneful Bond - On a hit, possibly Bane your target.

  • How to obtain : Purchase from Blurg at Ebonlake Grotto.

Sword of Life Stealing

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Sword of Life Stealing

Shortsword

480 Gold

Very Rare

Life Stealing Critical - On a Critical Hit, the target takes an extra 10 Necrotic damage as long as it isn't a construct or an undead. You also gain 10 Temp HP.

  • How to obtain : Sold by Dammon at Last Light Inn.

Best Weapons For Oath of the Crown Paladin

Best Weapon Types : STR or DEX-based melee weapons (depending on your build). Some function best as two-handed, while others thrive as a one-handed weapon with a Shield in your off-hand.

Sword of Life Stealing

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Sword of Life Stealing

Shortsword

480 Gold

Very Rare

Life Stealing Critical - On a Critical Hit, the target takes an extra 10 Necrotic damage as long as it isn't a construct or an undead. You also gain 10 Temp HP.

  • How to obtain : Sold by Dammon at Last Light Inn.

Hoppy

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Hoppy

War Pick

100 Gold

Uncommon

Revitalizing Strike - Smash into a foe, wounding them and healing your own injuries (once per Short Rest).

  • How to obtain : Sold by Lady Esther on the Mountain Pass.

Phalar Aluve

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Phalar Aluve

Longsword

250 Gold

Rare

Performance +1

Phalar Aluve: Melody - The sword hums in anticipation, ready to Sing or Shriek once per Short Rest.

  • How to obtain : Embedded inside a rock in the Underdark at approximately X: 116 Y: -192

Larethian's Wrath

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Larethian's Wrath

Longsword

250 Gold

Rare

Razor Gale - Swing your weapon in a cyclone of steel that deals razorblade-sharp damage to all enemies within range.(Once per Short Rest).

  • How to obtain : Sold by A'jak'nir Jeera at the Githyanki Creche.

The Blood of Lathander

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

The Blood of Lathander

Mace

649

Legendary

Sunbeam - Lv. 6 spell once per Long Rest.

Lathander's Blessing - Once per Long Rest, when your hit points are reduced to 0, you regain 2d6 HP. Allies within 30 ft also regain 1d6 HP.

Lathander's Light - Sheds holy light in a 20 ft radius. In combat, fiends and undead standing in the light are Blinded if they fail a DC 14 Con Save.

  • How to obtain : On a locked altar in the Secret Chamber of the Githyanki Creche.

Best Weapons For Shadow Magic Sorcerer

Best Weapon Types : Mostly Quarterstaffs, or other weapons that the Sorcerer is Proficient in and can also add extra value to your Spells.

Creation's Echo

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Creation's Echo

Quarterstaff

310 Gold

Rare

Elemental Resonance - If the wielder deals Acid, Fire, Lightning, Radiant, or Necrotic damage, they become resistant to that damage type for 2 turns.

  • How to obtain : Sold by Omeluum at the Myconid Colony after completing his quest "Help Omeluum investigate the parasite."

Melf's First Staff

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Melf's First Staff

Quarterstaff

100 Gold

Uncommon

Melf's Acid Arrow - Cast at lv. 2 once per Long Rest.

Arcane Enchantment - You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack rolls.

  • How to obtain : Sold by Blurg at the Myconid Colony.

Markoheshkir

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Markoheshkir

Quarterstaff

640 Gold

Legendary

Kereska's Favour - Cast as a level 4 spell once per Short Rest.

Arcane Enchantment - You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack rolls.

Arcane Battery - Alleviate the arcane burden of spellcasting with the power of this staff. The next spell you cast doesn't cost a spell slot.

  • How to obtain : Found in a Globe of Invulnerability at Ramazith's Tower.

Staff of Spellpower

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Staff of Spellpower

Quarterstaff

480 Gold

Very Rare

Arcane Enchantment - You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack rolls.

Arcane Battery - Alleviate the arcane burden of spellcasting with the power of this staff. The next spell you cast doesn't cost a spell slot.

  • How to obtain : In Raphael's Vault at the House of Hope.

Woe

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Woe

Quarterstaff

480 Gold

Legendary

Blight - Cast as a lv. 4 spell once per Short Rest.

Arcane Enchantment - You gain a +1 bonus to Spell Save DC and Spell Attack rolls.

Arcane Vampirism - When the creatures affected by your spells fail any associated Saving throws, you regain 1d4 HP.

  • How to obtain : Reward for defeating Cazador during The Pale Elf quest.

Best Weapons For Swarmkeeper Ranger

Best Weapon Types : Primarily DEX-based weapons such as bows at range, and rapiers or dual shortswords and daggers for close range. Some builds can even make use of dual-wielding crossbows.

Hellfire Hand Crossbow

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Hellfire Hand Crossbow

Bow

770 Gold

Very Rare

Scorching Ray - Cast as a lv. 3 spell once per Short Rest.

Hellstalker - Possibly inflict Burning when attacking while Hiding or Invisible.

  • How to obtain : Loot from Yurgir in the Gauntlet of Shar.

Firestoker

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Firestoker

Bow

100 Gold

Uncommon

Burned Alive - Deals an additional 1d4 Weapon damage to Burning targets.

  • How to obtain : Inside a chest at Grymforge in the room with the Hellsboars.

Phalar Aluve

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Phalar Aluve

Longsword

250 Gold

Rare

Performance +1

Phalar Aluve: Melody - The sword hums in anticipation, ready to Sing or Shriek once per Short Rest.

  • How to obtain : Embedded inside a rock in the Underdark at approximately X: 116 Y: -192

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Least Expected

Bow

190 Gold

Rare

Darkveil Precision - While obscured in shadow, the wielder has a +1d4 bonus to their ranged weapon attacks.

  • How to obtain : In a gilded chest beyond the locked puzzle door in the Gauntlet of Shar.

Ne'er Misser

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Ne'er Misser

Bow

310 Gold

Rare

(Deals Force damage instead of regular weapon damage)

Magic Missile - Cast as a lv. 3 spell once per Short Rest.

  • How to obtain : Sold by Roah Moonglow at Moonrise Towers.

Best Weapons For Swashbuckler Rogue

Best Weapon Types : Primarily DEX-based finesse weapons such as rapiers, shortswords, and daggers—usually also including a bow as a ranged weapon.

Duelist's Prerogative

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Duelist's Prerogative

Rapier

1300 Gold

Legendary

Challenge to Duel - Challenge an enemy to attack only you, inflicting Bleeding on the target.

Elegant Duelist - While your off-hand is empty, you score a Critical Hit when rolling a 19. Moreover, you gain an additional Reaction per turn.

Withering Cut - On a hit with a melee weapon, use a Reaction to deal additional Necrotic damage equal to your Proficiency Bonus.

  • How to obtain : Reward from Lora Bergauz for completing the quest "Save Vanra."

Rarity

65 Gold

Uncommon

Hunter's Mark - Cast at lv. 1 once per Long Rest.

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

The Dancing Breeze

DEX/Finesse Glaive

960 Gold

Very Rare

Whirlwind Attack - Strike out at all nearby foes, making separate Attack Rolls against each target once per Short Rest.

  • How to obtain : Purchase from Exxvikyap in Rivington.

Best Weapons For Way of the Drunken Master Monk

Best Weapon Types : Monks tend to use Unarmed Strikes, and a few particular STR or DEX-based melee weapons depending on their build. There are also a couple of niche picks that add more utility to the Drunken Master Monk's mechanics.

Punch-Drunk Bastard

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Punch-Drunk Bastard

Greatclub

190 Gold

Rare

Tippler's Rage - While you are Drunk, you have Advantage on Attack rolls. You also create a blast with each attack, dealing 1d4 Thunder damage for 10 ft.

  • How to obtain : In a chest in the back area to the west, next to a trapped cage door inside The Waning Moon.

Hunting Shortbow

Item

Type

Price

Rarity

Damage/Effect/Description

Hunting Shortbow

Bow

65 Gold

Uncommon

Hunter's Mark - Cast at lv. 1 once per Long Rest.

Feller of Monsters - You have an Advantage against Monstrosity-type enemies.

Price

Bonuses/Effects

Bow

Uncommon

Seldom Caught Unawares - You gain a +1 bonus to Initiative Rolls

Item Name

Type

Price

Rarity

Bonuses/Effects

Darkfire Shortbow

Bow

480 Gold

Rare

Resistance to Fire and Cold damage

Haste - Cast at lv. 3 once per Short Rest.

  • How to obtain : Purchase from Dammon at Last Light Inn.

Trident

840 Gold

Legendary

Zephyr Connection - This weapon will return to your hand when thrown. You cannot be forced to drop the trident. When thrown, the weapon creates an explosion that deals 3d4 Thunder damage in a 20 ft blast centered on the target.

Veil of the Wind - You gain a 10 ft movement speed and jump distance bonus. Equipping this weapon gives you Immunity to falling damage.

Nyrulna: Glowing - This object shines with a glowing light in a radius of 20 ft.

  • How to obtain : In a locked painted chest, near the portal to exit the Jungle area that you get to through Akabi the Genie's wheel.

item.title: 10 Games That Let You Roleplay As Yourself (Without Being The Hero), Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Games like Stardew Valley and Animal Crossing offer players a cozy, stress-free gaming experience.
  • Unlike traditional hero-focused games, players can enjoy domestic living and form emotional bonds in these games.
  • Players can roleplay as themselves in games like The Sims 4, focusing on relationships, careers, and self-expression.

Some games thrust players into the role of hero, but what if they just want to play it casually, or live a new domestic life instead? This topic aims to look at some of the best games out there that let players roleplay as themselves, without worrying about their heroic tendencies or not.

There is no need to save the world in these games. Instead, players can focus on other choices they might have to make that allow them to have a good gameplay experience. Whether that is domestic life or something a little more adventurous, there will be something for everyone.

10 Harvest Moon: One World

Cozy Farm Life

Harvest Moon: One World
Strategy
Systems
Released
March 2, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone due to In-Game Purchases
Powered by
  • Domestic Living
  • Stable Routine
  • Farm, Love, Grow

Harvest Moon ’s long-running franchise proves to players that having a farm life can be just as enjoyable and exciting as something more adventurous. In this particular installment, players can create themselves in the likeness of a farmer whose life revolved around farming, friendship, and family.

The only world players are saving is the little one they have on their farm, with low stakes such as crops being in season, and finding the right person to spend their time with. The game encourages routing and emotional bonds with players, perfect if they are looking to have something more casual in their gaming time.

9 Story Of Seasons: Pioneers Of Olive Town

Farming Through Seasons

Story of Seasons: Pioneers of Olive Town
Released
February 25, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
6 /10

Powered by
  • Everyday Rural
  • Cozy Life
  • Seasons Spent Together

Story of Seasons is much like Harvest Moon in its lifestyle it can offer. Players are not the hero of the story. Instead, they are just a local looking to contribute in their own way, which is a powerful story in itself. Players can romance many characters so that they can become part of their lives, including the game offering same-gender companionship too.

Story of Seasons lets players find fulfillment in the everyday, and with the chance of season being one of the biggest parts of the game, life can be tranquil and cozy for players.

8 Calico

Kitty Cat Galore

Calico
Life Simulation
Systems
Released
December 15, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
e
Powered by
  • Cat Café Charm
  • Whimsy Atmosphere
  • Magical Chill

Calico allows players to be a magical café owner with whimsy. Roleplaying as themselves, players can focus on their daily tasks and creativity in-game, knowing there is no big bad out there. Decorate the café and cuddle the cats, and if players need a little hero but not too much, they can run an errand or two for other villagers.

This game is one of those that offers zero pressure on gameplay, with no need to worry about fighting monsters. Players can put their focus on self-expression in this magical world and just explore their environment.

7 Minecraft

Blocks Of Creative Wonder

Minecraft
148
8.9 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Powered by
  • Build Your World
  • Peaceful Creativity Mode
  • Be Whoever, Do Whatever

Minecraft is one of the ultimate sandbox games out there, that allows players to just have a cozy life and not fight monsters at all. With the choices of a peaceful or semi-peaceful playthrough, players may never have to even see an enemy in the game, and can focus on other animals instead.

With the option to play as themselves with any skin they can find or make, players can be the person they would like to be, focusing on builds, mechanics, farming, and so much more. There are no guidelines on what players need to do, and they can instead follow their hearts.

6 Hello Kitty Island Adventure

Sanrio & You

Hello Kitty Island Adventure
10.0 /10
Released
July 28, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone
Powered by
  • Gentle Daily Goals
  • Sanrio Simulator
  • No Stressful Quests

Hello Kitty Island Adventure does allow players to roleplay as themselves, but in animal form. This allows players to blend in with the world around them. While there are quests to do for the characters or to unlock new spaces, there is no time limit or pressure, and instead some quests take several IRL days to complete, keeping the pace slow.

Players will appreciate the ability to be the kind of character they want to on the island, whether they choose to help characters out, or focus on having the best house on the island.

5 Animal Crossing: New Horizons

Island Life At Your Pace

Animal Crossing: New Horizons
9 /10
25
8.4 /10
Released
March 20, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
9 /10
25
8.4 /10

ESRB
E for Everyone: Comic Mischief
Powered by
  • Island Life Reset
  • Chill With Villagers
  • Slow-paced Daily Tasks

Animal Crossing: New Horizons is one of the best storyless games out there, with players being able to focus on just about anything with no pressure to progress. Players can choose to live outside a tent for the entirety of their time in the game and never give Tom Nook any of their hard-earned money.

Because the villagers all have different personalities, players can choose what kind of characters they want for their neighbors. While the player is the mayor of the town, they can choose not to live by that label and instead focus on meeting new people.

4 Tiny Life

Domesticated Life In Pixel Form

  • Pixelated Style
  • Domestic sandbox
  • Soft chaos

Tiny Life is a pixel-style game that allows players to live out a domesticated life in their own way. Characters can be customized and tailored to be a mini-player lookalike, and their life is a very simple and casual one, perfect for times when fans want to escape reality but in a cozy way.

Players can choose to help their mini-me build new relationships or skills or instead choose to cathartically make their lives something more like a misery, with surprises waiting around every corner.

3 Stardew Valley

Farmer Goes Dating

Stardew Valley
63
9.1 /10
Released
February 26, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone (Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood, Mild Language, Simulated Gambling, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco)
Powered by
  • Be A Farmer
  • Love, Fish, Plant
  • Your Rules

Stardew Valley starts with a big change for players as their grandpa’s farm has been left for them to run. But once they get there, players get to choose exactly what they want to do with their time. While turning a profit is recommended to keep the farm running, they can spend more time romancing the locals or even exploring caves to find treasure.

Players can roleplay themselves in the game and make choices that they would in their real lives. Choosing whether to help villagers or not, or even who to talk to and hang around with. There is so much to do every day in the valley, and no need to play the hero.

2 Inzoi

Realistic Visuals For Your Digital Life

InZOI
9 /10
22
8.2 /10
Released
March 28, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
9 /10
22
8.2 /10

Powered by
  • Realistic Roleplay
  • Relationships With Reward
  • Careers, Homes, Goals

InZOI is a newer title on the list and is a sandbox game with so many possibilities. Players can choose to be a version of themselves and have a new life. There are no high-stakes or hero playing. Instead, players can choose to work on their career or relationships and build something they can always come back to.

The character customization is very well detailed and realistic, making sure that players can match their digital avatar as closely as they would like.

1 Sims 4

Focus Into Flow

The Sims 4
7 /10
60
8.5 /10
Released
September 2, 2014

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL
7 /10
60
8.5 /10

ESRB
T for Teen: Crude Humor, Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by
  • Ultimate Life Sim
  • No Rules
  • Your Choices Matter

The Sims 4 has to be one of the ultimate choices for players looking to explore a new life as a digital self in a game. The Sims 4 , like IRL, does not have clear goals or expectations, and instead lets the players choose what to do with their life and what skills to build on.

Players can choose to be the hero of their own story rather than fighting a monster or villain. Maybe they might even choose to be the villain instead, and terrorize their neighbors as they live their new digital life.

item.title: Best Rupture Teams In Limbus Company
item.description:
Summary

  • Limbus Company offers diverse team compositions and play styles with unique sin affinities and status effects.
  • Rupture status effect deals fixed damage to single targets, ideal for boss fights in the game.
  • Various Rupture teams like Sacrifice, Stack Retention, and Heishou provide different strategies for different scenarios.

The turn-based gacha RPG from Project Moon, Limbus Company , continues to add new challenges, with new Cantos and new IDs released regularly. The game takes inspiration from Project Moon's previous games, Library of Ruina and Lobotomy Corporation , with the same anime-inspired aesthetic and complex systems of characters, affinities, and elements.

Thanks to the game's many systems, like sin affinities, status effects, E.G.O. skills, and the many variations of character IDs, there are a huge number of team compositions and play styles that players can employ in Limbus Company . Rupture is a status effect that is primarily used for taking down single targets, like abnormalities. That's because Rupture deals fixed damage (damage that cannot be resisted) to enemies once stacked, so players can chain consistently high additional damage on targets by maintaining their stacks, and burst down even tough bosses quickly.

Recent updates have added even more variations to the possibilities for Rupture-based teams, with new IDs that can even give teams some viability outside boss fights and in Mirror Dungeons. For players looking for the best combination of character IDs to make up their roster, these are some of the best Rupture teams in Limbus Company.

3 Rupture Sacrifice Team

Yi Sang Sacrifice

Team/Slots:

  • Slot 1: Devyat Assoc. Rodion
  • Slot 2: Heishou Pack Mao Branch Ryoshu
  • Slot 3: Heishou Pack Mao Branch Outis
  • Slot 4: LCE E.G.O. Lantern Yi Sang
  • Slot 5: Lobotomy E.G.O. Lantern Don Quixote
  • Slot 6: Seven Assoc. Heathcliff

Supports:

  • Lobotomy E.G.O. Red Sheet (Talisman) Sinclair
  • Rosespanner Workshop Fixer Gregor
  • K. Corp Class 3 Excision Staff Hong Lu
  • Cinq Assoc. Meursault (sub-in team member)

This version of the Rupture team is designed to apply high Rupture count and potency quickly. There are two ways that this composition achieves this. The first is through using units to create early Gluttony affinity chains, allowing Devyat Rodion to use her skill three to build up 16 Rupture potency and three count per hit. The second is with LCE E.G.O. Lantern Yi Sang, this unit needs to be kept low level, as the trick to using them is to lose clashes and die while the ability Fairy Lure is active.

Thanks to the units abilities, this will apply even more Rupture to the enemy, and buff the Rupture abilities of the unit who subs in for them. In this case, Cinq Assoc. Meursault is used to sub-in, as by the time he comes out, players will have enough Rupture count and potency stacked to make his moves count neutral (this means he won't deplete Rupture stacks when attacking). This composition uses the Mao Branch IDs for Ryoshu and Outis, as these units have high base power as well as Rupture and Gluttony synergy, but there are other options that will work in these two slots, like K. Corp Hong Lu, or Seven Assoc. Faust.

2 Sustain Rupture Team

Rupture Stack Retention

Team/Slots:

  • Slot 1: Devyat Assoc. Rodion
  • Slot 2: Heishou Pack Mao Branch Ryoshu
  • Slot 3: Heishou Pack Mao Branch Outis
  • Slot 4: W. Corp L3 Cleanup Agent Yi Sang
  • Slot 5: Cinq Assoc. Meursault
  • Slot 6: Seven Assoc. Heathcliff

Supports:

  • Lobotomy E.G.O. Red Sheet (Talisman) Sinclair
  • Rosespanner Workshop Fixer Gregor
  • K. Corp Class 3 Excision Staff Hong Lu

This version of the Rupture team works similarly to the composition above, but instead of using the LCE ID for Yi Sang, this group uses W. Corp Yi Sang for his Rupture and Gluttony synergy and Dimension Rift, his skill three, which can be very potent in Rupture teams. In this case, players want a fully leveled Yi Sang, as he'll be used as a full team member rather than a sacrifice in this lineup. Essentially, players are still looking to get a four-skill gluttony chain on turn one to start building Rupture potency and count quickly.

One important thing to note is that this team will be more effective if Rodion has the highest HP at the end of turn one, as she will benefit most from Red Sheet Sinclair's Talisman passive buff. This is why Lantern Don Quixote has been replaced by Cinq Assoc. Meursault here, as Don normally has slightly higher base HP than Rodion and often takes the buff if used. Barring this situation, any of the previously mentioned slot 5/6 units should also work in these positions.

1 Heishou Rupture Team

Long Fight Rupture Squad

Team/Slots:

  • Slot 1: Heishou Pack Mao Branch Outis
  • Slot 2: Heishou Pack Mao Branch Ryoshu
  • Slot 3: Heishou Pack Si Branch Rodion
  • Slot 4: Seven Assoc. Faust
  • Slot 5: Cinq Assoc. Meursault
  • Slot 6: K. Corp Class 3 Excision Staff Hong Lu

Supports:

  • Lobotomy E.G.O. Red Sheet (Talisman) Sinclair
  • Rosespanner Workshop Fixer Gregor
  • Seven Assoc. Heathcliff

While Devyat Rodion has been the center-piece for most Rupture teams for some time now, her newer ID, Heishou Pack Si Branch Rodion, can be just as effective, if not more so. Adding her to the team with the Heishou Pack Mao Branch IDs leads to a Rupture team that gets all the synergies of the previous group for building count and potency, but also enough IDs with high base power levels to be usable outside of Rupture teams' normal comfort zone, boss fights. With that said, piling up fixed damage on single targets is still this team's strong point.

This team excels in boss fights that can't be won in four turns or less with a standard Rupture setup, as a slightly longer setup leads to potentially better payoffs, with the use of Si Branch Rodion's skill two and three for high coin count Rupture procs. Since the Si Branch Rodion ID has relatively low HP, the Talisman buff in this setup will likely be taken by K. Corp Hong Lu, but that can be utilized with his E.G.O. skill Lasso for massive damage, if players get the opportunity. Other setups can burst down bosses faster, but this team can last in a prolonged fight and works better in Mirror Dungeons, too.

Limbus Company
9.0 /10
Released
February 26, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
t
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, Microsoft Windows
Powered by

item.title: Phasmophobia Challenge Mode - How to Complete Hide and Seek Extreme
item.description:
When it comes to hunting ghosts in Phasmophobia , there's no shortage of hair-raising scenarios for players to test their paranormal investigator skills. Better yet, the rewards for such challenges are often well worth seeking out the most dangerous ghosts in the game, especially those in the so-called Challenge Mode

Challenge Mode features some of the most ambitious weekly tasks available in Phasmophobia, and one such task is the Hide and Seek: Extreme challenge. If you find yourself unsure of how to tackle this one, here's everything you need to know.

What is Challenge Mode in Phasmophobia?

Challenge Mode is a unique difficulty (and weekly task) in Phasmophobia that allows players to take on a wide variety of investigation challenges for significant rewards and achievements. Many of those challenges feature the most difficult ghost-hunting scenarios in the entire game — some even on par with the infamous Gold Apocalypse challenge.

The investigations involved in these challenges include specific equipment loadouts that cannot be altered in any way, though at the same time, they're provided to you free of charge. So should you fail during an attempt, there's no cost to you. The loadout also isn't affected by your current level and what you've personally unlocked/upgraded in terms of equipment.

To receive full rewards for the weekly Challenge Mode, you must successfully complete the challenge in question at least three times . In terms of what qualifies for completion, you simply need to guess the ghost's identity correctly . Completing optional objectives is not required but can boost your rewards.

Your progress is tracked via the main lobby board (seen above). Once done, you'll obtain a base reward of $5,000 , plus any extra points earned from the investigations themselves (including bonuses from any other daily/weekly tasks). If you're looking to level and prestige your character as much as possible, these challenges are incredibly helpful for doing so.

When Does Challenge Mode Reset in Phasmophobia?

Like other weekly tasks in the game, the Challenge Mode resets at 0:00 UTC every Monday morning . The exact time obviously depends on your specific time zone, but this reset timer is the same each week. When it comes to Challenge Mode, you must complete the three required investigations for it before this server reset to obtain its respective rewards on time.

Once the server does reset its weekly timer, a new challenge will be presented on the main lobby board, and the timer at the bottom of the chart will reflect the change.

How to Complete Hide and Seek Extreme Challenge in Phasmophobia

To queue for the Hide and Seek: Extreme Challenge in Phasmophobia , you first need to select either Singleplayer or Multiplayer from the main lobby menu. Next, go to your Difficulty Settings and scroll over until you find the Challenge Mode option. Select 'Apply' at the bottom right corner (as seen above), and your queue will be set for the challenge.

Lastly, pivot left over to the map board and look for Camp Woodwind at the very bottom right corner, next to Maple Lodge Campsite. Like other challenges, this one must be completed on the map indicated in the task description. If you choose a different map, your progress will not be counted toward challenge completion.

Hide and Seek Extreme Challenge Rules

Hide and Seek: Extreme is arguably one of the most difficult weekly challenges in Phasmophobia (alongside others such as the Sanity Survival challenge) due to its strict rules that lean heavily in favor of the ghost lurking within the campsite.

Right off the bat, you'll notice that you start this investigation with 0% sanity available to you, and unfortunately, there's no sanity medication to help recover it. This means that the ghost, regardless of type, can attempt to hunt you immediately upon stepping into the campsite (once the setup time is depleted). You'll get just one minute of setup time , which allows you to track down the ghost's location and bring in as much equipment as you can before things turn dangerous.

Thankfully, the fuse box (a red generator in this case) can be used during this challenge and will be on at the start of this investigation. While it can't preserve the sanity you don't have, it can help keep the map well-lit as you gather evidence, particularly since you don't have Flashlights to help light your way.

Furthermore, the ghost will have 150% movement speed during hunts , so you'll want to tread carefully. There will be very few hiding spots to make use of, and the ghost will have a tendency to change its favorite room/area frequently during this challenge, so stay vigilant.

Lastly, the ghost will exhibit an average level of activity, so make sure to pay attention when it occurs. Especially because ghost events (e.g. singing, lights breaking, misting) will rarely happen during this challenge.

Hide and Seek Extreme Loadout & Cursed Objects

The loadout you're provided for the Hide and Seek: Extreme challenge in Phasmophobia is a reasonable assortment of Tier 1 and Tier 2 equipment , and you'll want to know how to make the best of everything you have.

In all, you'll have the following items at your disposal:

  • Tier 1 Head Gear - While it doesn't come with a flashlight, this head gear can still be useful, especially when playing in a group. It features a camera of its own that your party members can watch as you move around the map.
  • Matches (Tier 1 Igniter) - Matches are useful in this scenario for lighting the bonfire near the campsite's entrance, or lighting Firelights.
  • Tier 1 Motion Sensors - These are best used for finding the ghost's initial location (especially on smaller maps like this one) and subsequently tracking its movement, in case it changes areas.
  • Tier 1 Firelight - Firelights are normally used for helping to preserve sanity, but in this case, they're better used for helping keep the map lit. Alternatively, if you think you're dealing with an Onyro ghost, you can use your Firelights to "test" for it. Beware that doing so will trigger a hunt if it is indeed an Onryo.
  • Tier 1 Parabolic Microphone - This is actually one of the best tools for finding the ghost's location, as it will pick up any audible activity from it. You can also "test" for either a Banshee (will scream into the microphone) or a Deogen (will breathe heavily into the microphone).
  • Tier 1 Salt - Since UV Flashlights are not available for this challenge, salt can be used for ghost photos instead, if needed.
  • Tier 2 Crucifixes - These are your strongest defense against ghost hunts, as they'll prevent said hunts when placed properly in the ghost's favorite area.
  • Tier 1 Sound Sensors - Similar to the Parabolic Microphone, these can be used to figure out the ghost's location by sound. If you have a party member in the van, they can listen to the ghost's movement speed during a hunt as well.
  • Tier 2 EMF Readers - These are used to detect EMF readings from the ghost, up to level EMF 5 (a potential evidence option).
  • Tier 2 Photo Cameras - These are used to take photos of ghosts and their activity for extra investigation points.
  • Tier 2 Spirit Boxes - These are used to detect Spirit Box evidence, if applicable.
  • Tier 2 Thermometers - These are used to check for Freezing Temperature evidence, if applicable. They can be useful for finding the ghost's location as well if need be.
  • Tier 1 Ghost Writing Books - These are used to check for Ghost Writing evidence, if applicable. If the ghost decides to throw the book instead of writing in it, this means that it cannot be possible evidence.
  • Tier 2 DOTS Projectors - These are used to check for DOTS evidence, if applicable. Certain ghosts will react differently to DOTS equipment, so pay close attention.
  • Tier 1 Video Cameras (w/ tripods) - Video Cameras are useful for many things, such as detecting Ghost Orb evidence, or just a convenient way to keep an eye on the ghost's current location and its activity, especially during hunts.

The types of equipment that will not be available during this challenge include Sanity Medication, Incense, UV Lights, and Flashlights.

Meanwhile, there will be a Monkey Paw Cursed Object available during each attempt of this challenge. You can find it lying on the Lovers Bench at the backside of the campsite (as seen above) , next to sticks full of marshmallows. You're not required to use it for completion, but if you want to, do so wisely as the Monkey Paw is one of the most dangerous Cursed Objects in the game.

Your comment has not been saved

Follow
Followed

item.title: 8 Best Open-World Top-Down Games, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Top-down games like Foxhole and Rustler offer unique gameplay experiences for players to enjoy.
  • Developers are still valuing the top-down perspective, creating more realistic open-world experiences.
  • Games like GTA 2 inspire modern top-down open-world games, providing chaotic and fun gameplay.

Although technological advancements have led some of the developers to ditch some old-school camera types like top-down and go fully third-person, top-down games still exist, and they still deliver tons of fun if other aspects of the game are done correctly as well.

The fact that the top-down view gives players a better environmental awareness still makes it a perfect choice for hack-and-slash or turn-based combat systems. And the good news is that developers still value the top-down perspective, and they do benefit from the technological advancements to make open-world top-down experiences with more realistic visuals and bigger worlds.

8 Foxhole

Work Within An Army To Define The Fate Of Battles

Foxhole
10.0 /10
Released
August 4, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
Microsoft Windows
Powered by

When talking about MMOs, the first things that come to mind are probably games like Genshin Impact , Grand Theft Auto Online , Destiny 2 , or some other sci-fi experiences, but Foxhole takes quite a unique take on this genre by strictly focusing on every detail of a battle.

Instead of just magnifying the action part of the game, Foxhole tries to value all reasons behind a front's victory or failure equally. The roles are no longer limited to being a trooper or a frontline fighter. Logistics also plays a crucial role, and the same goes for support and engineering units.

In Foxhole , each role is like a gear in a clock. If a team lacks good work in one part, it will fail, no matter how good they are on the frontlines.

7 Minishoot Adventures

An Open-World Bullet Hell Chaos

Minishoot' Adventures
Metroidvania
Twin-Stick Shooter
Systems
Released
April 2, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
SoulGame Studio
Platform(s)
PC
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

At first glimpse, Minishoot' Adventures looks like a charming experience set in a colorful world, but don't let the cuteness of the art hide the hardcore battles! This game is recommended to the die-hard fans of the bullet hell genre, and the open-world take helps a lot with improving the gameplay loop.

Upon exploring a gorgeous, handcrafted world, meet some deadly enemies hidden inside dungeons. Beating each enemy is an opportunity to upgrade the spaceship and its weapons to prepare for the harder battles ahead.

6 GTA 2

Old But Still Aging Well

Grand Theft Auto 2
7.8 /10
Released
February 13, 1999

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

Developer(s)
Rockstar North, Rockstar Games
Franchise
Grand Theft Auto
Platform(s)
PlayStation (Original), PC, Sega Dreamcast, Nintendo Game Boy Color
Powered by

Although it might have lost its glory with the massive technological advancements over the years, Grand Theft Auto 2 is still holding up well and is still quite playable. The series will probably never go back to its top-down perspective, but the chaotic gameplay is still fun and smooth.

Grand Theft Auto 2 is the source of inspiration for any modern top-down open-world experiences, especially the ones that try to recreate similar vibes. The game is played almost like 3D entries of the series. Players can rob every vehicle they want, they can raise chaos in the city by shooting and killing, and they have lots of action-packed missions to complete in between.

5 Rustler

A Medieval Take On The Original GTA

Rustler

Released
February 18, 2021
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox One
Powered by

Rustler is a near-perfect translation of Grand Theft Auto 2 into the modern gaming standards, but within a medieval era. The developers have successfully taken inspiration from both old-school and modern games of the Grand Theft Auto series, and the result is a fun and chaotic open-world experience with a light-hearted story that doesn't take itself too seriously.

Considering the game's era, cars have been replaced by horses, but raising chaos in the world is still quite easy, and the mission design is also intriguing, encouraging players to come back for more. Though the post-story experience might not be as satisfying as a GTA game.

4 American Fugitive

A Festival Of Crime And Action

American Fugitive

Released
May 21, 2019
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, Xbox One
Powered by

Telling a crime story in a small county of the United States back in the 1980s, American Fugitive is another great inspiration from Grand Theft Auto 2 with modern visuals, satisfying environment destruction, and an action-packed story about criminals.

The game has the players following a campaign within an open-world town. Players can steal cars, fight with police officers, and ram through anything blocking their path to complete their mission.

The same developers released The Precinct as well, which is a lawful version of American Fugitive set in a compact city. Both games are quite fun and enjoyable with similar gameplay systems, but American Fugitive is just a little bit more chaotic for those who want to have unlimited fun!

3 Maniac

Vampire Survivor Meets Grand Theft Auto

Almost every Grand Theft Auto player has tried to reach the maximum wanted level at least once and then fight for survival. Maniac takes this specific part from Grand Theft Auto and turns it into an utterly satisfying video game, while also borrowing some features from Vampire Survivors .

The game is set in a highly destructible city, and the goal is to turn it upside down. There are multiple characters available that each of which comes with unique gear and abilities. Players must use their weapons to raise hell in the world while dealing with ever-growing waves of police forces trying to take them down.

  • Developer: Transhuman Design
  • Release Date: March 28, 2024
  • Platform: PC

2 Running With Rifles

A Tactical Shooter Set In An Open-World Environment

  • Developer: Osumia Games
  • Release Date: April 2, 2015
  • Platform: PC

Tired of all the explosions and chaos? Then let's switch to a more slow-paced tactical experience while staying true to the rules of open-world and top-down. There are many tactical top-down shooters in the market, but Running With Rifles is the game that takes that one extra step towards expanding its world. So, instead of trapping players in a linear story, this game lets them pick their own path.

Running With Rifles is a game for the dedicated. Those who have the patience to design a plan and follow it step-by-step. The game features on-foot combat as well as vehicles, but at the end of the day, it's the calculated moves that will be rewarded.

1 Darkwood

Experience A True Feel Of Horror And Survival

6 Images
6 Images
Darkwood
7 /10
9.0 /10
Released
August 18, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
7 /10
9.0 /10

Developer(s)
Acid Wizard Studio
Platform(s)
Xbox One, PS4, PC, Switch
OpenCritic Rating
Strong
Powered by

It's been a long time since Darkwood was released, and yet no other survival experience has managed to meet its intensity. Darkwood never fails to put the player in an overly stressful situation, where the craving for staying alive meets the suspension of facing another deadly threat.

The best way to describe Darkwood is to call it a single-player and top-down version of DayZ . The game always follows an unexpected route, and players must be prepared for everything at any moment. The game features a day and night cycle. During the day, players must scavenge for resources, and when night falls, they need to reinforce their hideout and survive the brutal attacks.
